quiz.question: Who famously declared "Give me liberty or give me death" during a colonial speech?
Which American president said "The buck stops here" placing responsibility in the Oval Office?
Who wrote "Give me chastity and continence, but not yet" in playful theological reflection?
Who famously stated "I came, I saw, I conquered" in Latin?
Which revolutionary wrote "Give me liberty, or give me death" in a famous Virginia speech?
Who wrote "Better to die on your feet than live on your knees" in anti-colonial struggle?
Which activist said "The only thing necessary for evil to triumph is for good men to do nothing"?
Who said "You must be the change you wish to see in the world"?
Which Renaissance thinker wrote "Fortune favors the bold" in a treatise on rulers and risk?
Who famously said "Let them eat cake" is popularly attributed to which figure?
Which leader said "The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today"?
Which Irish leader declared "The cause of liberty is not the cause of a race" during independence?
Who opened a famed address with "Four score and seven years ago"?
Who wrote "Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it" as a historian?
Who wrote "It is easier to ask forgiveness than permission" attributed to a pragmatic wartime leader?
